english: By the parties ranged in close ranks,
And by those who drive away the clouds or by those parties who severely reprimand evils,
Then by those parties that remember Allah (or) recite (the Holy Qur’an),
Surely, your God is One,

arabic: رَّبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ الْمَشَارِقِ
english: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever (creation) is between them, and the Lord of every point of sunrise.

arabic: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا السَّمَاءَ الدُّنْيَا بِزِينَةٍ الْكَوَاكِبِ
english: Surely, We have adorned the world’s heaven (the first heavenly sphere) with the adornment of stars and planets,
And made (them) secure from every rebellious satan.

arabic: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى الْمَلَإِ الْأَعْلَىٰ وَيُقْذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٍ
english: They (satans) cannot listen to the celestial world. And (burning brands) are thrown on them from every side,
To repulse them. And for them there is eternal torment.

arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ خَطِفَ الْخَطْفَةَ فَأَتْبَعَهُ شِهَابٌ ثَاقِبٌ
english: But that (satan) who snatches away (something from angels), a burning brand follows it in chase.

arabic: فَاسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَهُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَم مَّنْ خَلَقْنَا ۚ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُم مِّن طِينٍ لَّازِبٍ
english: Ask them: ‘Are they harder (and more difficult) to create, or those things which We have created (in the heavenly universe)? Surely, We have created them from a sticky clay.’
But you express your wonder whilst they make fun.
And when they are given advice, they do not accept it.
And when they see some sign, they mock it,

arabic: وَقَالُوا إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
english: And say: ‘This is but obvious magic.

arabic: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
english: What! When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, shall we certainly be raised (alive again)?
And shall our forefathers too (be raised)?’
Say: ‘Yes, (of course,) and you will be disgraced and humiliated (as well).’

arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجْرَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ فَإِذَا هُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
english: So, it will be merely a single dreadful shout (of a stern call). Then all will suddenly (rise and) begin to stare.

arabic: وَقَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ
english: And they will say: ‘Woe to us! This is the Day of Requital.’

arabic: هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ الْفَصْلِ الَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ
english: (It will be said: ‘Yes,) this is the same Day of Judgment which you used to reject.

arabic: ۞ احْشُرُوا الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا وَأَزْوَاجَهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا يَعْبُدُونَ
english: Assemble all those who committed injustice as well as their companions and followers and those (false gods) that they used to worship,

arabic: مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ فَاهْدُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطِ الْجَحِيمِ
english: Besides Allah. Then take them to the path of Hell.
And halt them (near the passage); they shall be interrogated.’
(It will be said to them:) ‘What has happened to you that you do not help one another?’
(What help can they provide?) For, in truth, they will be standing bending their necks Today.
And turning to one another, they will mutually question.

arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ الْيَمِينِ
english: They will say: ‘Surely, it is you who used to come to us from the right side (i.e., asserting on oath of being right).’
(Their misleading leaders) will say: ‘The truth is that it was you yourselves who did not believe.

arabic: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَانٍ ۖ بَلْ كُنتُمْ قَوْمًا طَاغِينَ
english: Nor did we have any authority (and control) over you. But you yourselves were a rebellious people.

arabic: فَحَقَّ عَلَيْنَا قَوْلُ رَبِّنَا ۖ إِنَّا لَذَائِقُونَ
english: So the command of our Lord has been proved against us. (Now) we are about to taste (the torment).
So we led you astray. Surely, we ourselves had gone astray.’
So on that Day, they (all) will share the torment.
No doubt, this is how We deal with the sinners.

arabic: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
english: Surely, they were such people that when it was said to them: ‘There is none worthy of worship except Allah,’ they used to show arrogance,

arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُو آلِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍ مَّجْنُونٍ
english: And used to say: ‘Are we going to forsake our gods for the sake of an insane poet?’
(He is neither an insane person nor a poet.) He has rather brought the truth (Din [Religion]) and confirmed the Messengers (of Allah).
Verily, you are about to taste the painful torment.

arabic: وَمَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
english: And you will not be given (any) reward but for what you used to do.
(Yes,) but those (exalted and chosen) servants of Allah who have divested themselves of (their ill-commanding selves and its pursuits),
It is they for whom a special provision is appointed (morning and evening),
Fruits (of every kind). And they will be honoured and venerated,
(Abiding) in Gardens of bliss and bounty,
(Making spiritual disclosures) face to face on raised couches.
Round them will be passed cups of (sacred) overflowing drink.
It will be sparkling white and superbly delicious, a treat for those who drink.

arabic: لَا فِيهَا غَوْلٌ وَلَا هُمْ عَنْهَا يُنزَفُونَ
english: It will not cause any harm or giddiness; nor will they lose balance (after drinking it).
And beside them will be (sitting chaste women) with lowered gazes and wide beautiful eyes,
(Fair, charming complexion, they will look) as if they were eggs protected from dust.
Then those (residents of Paradise) will turn to one another and mutually inquire (about their well-being).

arabic: قَالَ قَائِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ إِنِّي كَانَ لِي قَرِينٌ
english: One (of the participants in conversation) will say (to the other): ‘There was an acquaintance of mine (who disbelieved in the Hereafter).
He used to say (to me): Are you (also) of those who confirm and firmly believe (in these things)?

arabic: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ
english: (That) when we are dead and have become dust and bones, so shall we be requited (in that condition)?’
Then he (the dweller of Paradise) will say: ‘Will you peer down to see (him in which plight he is)?’
Then on peering down, he will find him (right) in the middle of Hell.
(He) will say (to him): ‘By my Lord, you had nearly ruined me.

arabic: وَلَوْلَا نِعْمَةُ رَبِّي لَكُنتُ مِنَ الْمُحْضَرِينَ
english: And had it not been the favour of my Lord, I (too) would have joined those who are brought (for torment with you).’
So (the dwellers of Paradise will gladly ask:) ‘Shall we not die now?

arabic: إِلَّا مَوْتَتَنَا الْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
english: Except for the first death (which we have passed through and have reached here) and shall we not be ever tormented?’
This is surely the supreme success.
For such (a success) the doers should do work.

arabic: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ نُّزُلًا أَمْ شَجَرَةُ الزَّقُّومِ
english: Is the hospitality (of Paradise) better or the tree of Zaqqum?
Undoubtedly, We have made this (tree) a torment for the wrongdoers.

arabic: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌ تَخْرُجُ فِي أَصْلِ الْجَحِيمِ
english: Truly, this is a tree that springs out from the bottom of Hell.
The spikes of its fruit are as if heads of (ugly) satans.

arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ لَآكِلُونَ مِنْهَا فَمَالِئُونَ مِنْهَا الْبُطُونَ
english: So the inmates of Hell have to eat of it alone and have to fill their bellies with the same.

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمْ عَلَيْهَا لَشَوْبًا مِّنْ حَمِيمٍ
english: Then for sure there will be scalding water mixed (with pus) for them after (eating, which will cut through their guts).
Then (after eating) surely they will return to Hell (again).
Surely, they found their ancestors misguided.
So they are made to rush on in their footsteps.
And in fact, most of the former people (also) lost the straight path.
And surely, We sent the Warners amongst them as well.
So see how was the end of those who were warned,
Except for the chosen and exalted servants of Allah.
And, verily, Nuh (Noah) cried to Us. So how excellent We are to respond to the prayers!
And We delivered him and his family from the ordeal.
And We made his offspring the only survivors.
And We made his virtuous remembrance endure amongst the successors (i.e., the Messengers and their people).
Peace be on Nuh (Noah) in all the worlds!
Surely, We requite the pious the same way.
He was indeed of Our servants blessed with (perfect) faith.
Then We drowned the others.
And verily, of his party was Ibrahim ([Abraham] as well, on him be peace).
When he appeared before his Lord with a purified and submissive heart,

arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَاذَا تَعْبُدُونَ
english: He said to his father (who was in fact his uncle, and he used to call him father, for he had brought him up) and his people: ‘What is it that you worship?
Do you go for false gods besides Allah, inventing a false allegation?
Well! What do you think of the Lord of all the worlds?’
Then Ibrahim (Abraham) cast a look at the stars (to put them in doubt),
And said: ‘I am not well (so cannot accompany you to the festival).’
At that they turned their backs on him and left (for the festival).

arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ آلِهَتِهِمْ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
english: Then Ibrahim (Abraham) went up to their gods (idols) quietly and said to them: ‘Do you not eat?
What is the matter with you that you do not speak?’
Then Ibrahim (Abraham) began striking (and breaking) them with full force.
Then the people came to him running (on returning from the festival).
Ibrahim (Abraham) said (to them): ‘Do you worship these (inanimate stones) which you yourselves carve out,
Whilst Allah has created you and (all) your doings?’

arabic: قَالُوا ابْنُوا لَهُ بُنْيَانًا فَأَلْقُوهُ فِي الْجَحِيمِ
english: They said: ‘Raise for him a building (to burn him), then cast him into the blazing fire (in it).’
So they attempted to play a trick against Ibrahim (Abraham), but We humiliated them (when the fire eventually turned into a flower garden).

arabic: وَقَالَ إِنِّي ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ
english: Then Ibrahim (Abraham) said: ‘(Migrating,) I am going to my Lord. He will certainly guide me.’ (He migrated to Syria).
(Reaching the sacred land, he prayed:) ‘O my Lord, bless me with (a son,) one of the pious.’
So We gave him the good news of a very forbearing son (Isma‘il [Ishmael]).

arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ السَّعْيَ قَالَ يَا بُنَيَّ إِنِّي أَرَىٰ فِي الْمَنَامِ أَنِّي أَذْبَحُكَ فَانظُرْ مَاذَا تَرَىٰ ۚ قَالَ يَا أَبَتِ افْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُ ۖ سَتَجِدُنِي إِن شَاءَ اللَّهُ مِنَ الصَّابِرِينَ
english: Then when (Isma‘il [Ishmael]) reached (the age of) the ability to run about with him, Ibrahim (Abraham) said: ‘O my son, I have seen in a dream that I am sacrificing you. So think, what is your opinion?’ Isma‘il (Ishmael) said: ‘O my father, do that (immediately) which you are being commanded. If Allah wills, you will find me amongst the patient (and steadfast).’
So when both submitted (to the will of Allah i.e., both surrendered to Allah’s command), and Ibrahim (Abraham) laid him down on his forehead—(the subsequent sight has not been described;)
And We called out to him: ‘O Ibrahim (Abraham)!

arabic: قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ الرُّؤْيَا ۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
english: (How wonderfully) have you made your dream really true!’ Surely, We pay back the spiritually excellent the same way. (So you are blessed with the prominence of Our closest friend.)
It was by far a great open trial.
And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice.
And We preserved his virtuous remembrance (i.e., praise) amongst the succeeding generations.
Peace be upon Ibrahim (Abraham)!
That is how We pay back those who are committed to spiritual excellence.
Surely, he was of Our servants with (perfect faith).
And (after Isma‘il [Ishmael]) We gave him the good news of Ishaq (Isaac). He was (also) a Prophet, one of the most pious.

arabic: وَبَارَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَىٰ إِسْحَاقَ ۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌ وَظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهِ مُبِينٌ
english: And We bestowed blessings on him and on Ishaq (Isaac). And amongst their descendants are both the virtuous as well as those who expressly wrong themselves.
And surely, We blessed Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron) as well with Our favours.
And We delivered them and their people from the ordeal.
And We helped them, so it was they who overmastered.
And We gave both of them the clear and enlightening Book (the Torah).
And We guided them both to the straight path.
And We preserved their virtuous remembrance (also) amongst the succeeding generations.
Peace be upon Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron)!
That is how We pay back those who are committed to spiritual excellence.
Surely, both of them were of Our servants blessed with (perfect faith).
And indeed, Ilyas (Elias too) was one of the Messengers.
When he said to his people: ‘Do you not fear (Allah)?
Do you worship (the idol named) Ba‘l and turn away from the Best of creators,
Allah, Who is your Lord and the Lord of your foregoing ancestors (as well)?’
But they (the people of Ba‘lbek) gave lie to Ilyas (Elias), so they will (also) be brought (to the torment of Hell),
Except the chosen servants of Allah.
And We preserved his virtuous remembrance (also) amongst the succeeding generations.
Peace be upon Ilyas (Elias)!
That is how We pay back those who are committed to spiritual excellence.
Surely, he was of Our servants blessed with (perfect faith).
And verily, Lut (Lot too) was one of the Messengers.
When We delivered him and the whole of his family,
Except that old woman who was of those who stayed behind;
Then We destroyed the others.
And surely, you pass by (the remains of their ruined towns whilst going from Mecca to Syria) in the morning,
And at night as well. Do you not even then understand?
And Yunus (Jonah too) was indeed one of the Messengers,
When he ran towards the full boat.
Then (when it was caught into a whirlpool) they cast lots, and (in the draws) he came to be the loser (i.e., his name was drawn and those in the boat cast him overboard into the river).
Then the fish swallowed him and he was a (self-condemning) repentant.
Then if he had not been of those who glorify (Allah),

arabic: لَلَبِثَ فِي بَطْنِهِ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
english: He would have stayed in the belly (of the fish) till the Day when people will be resurrected (from the graves).
Then We cast him onto a wide plain (i.e., the beach) whilst he was sick.
And We caused a creeping (gourd) plant to grow over him.

arabic: وَأَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ مِائَةِ أَلْفٍ أَوْ يَزِيدُونَ
english: And We sent him towards (the people of Nineveh in the land of Mosul,) a population of a hundred thousand or more.
(Seeing the signs of torment,) they believed. So We granted them prosperity for a time.
So ask these (disbelievers of Mecca): ‘Are there daughters for your Lord and sons for them?

arabic: أَمْ خَلَقْنَا الْمَلَائِكَةَ إِنَاثًا وَهُمْ شَاهِدُونَ
english: Did We create the angels as females and were they present (on the occasion)?’
Listen! They assuredly say (this) out of their fabrications,
That Allah has begotten children and surely they are liars.
Has He chosen daughters instead of sons? (The creed of the disbelievers of Mecca is being refuted in the language of their logic and mentality.)
What is the matter with you? How do you judge?
Do you not ponder?
Do you have any clear proof (to establish your philosophy and ideology)?
Produce your book if you are truthful.

arabic: وَجَعَلُوا بَيْنَهُ وَبَيْنَ الْجِنَّةِ نَسَبًا ۚ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمَتِ الْجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ
english: And they have fabricated a blood relationship between Allah and the jinn (as well), whereas the jinn know that they (too) will be made to appear (before the presence of Allah).
Holy is Allah, Transcendent of what they utter.
But the chosen and exalted servants of Allah (do not say such things; they are not amongst them).
So you and (the idols) which you worship,
You all cannot misguide (anyone against Allah),
Except the one who is bound to fall into Hell.

arabic: وَمَا مِنَّا إِلَّا لَهُ مَقَامٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
english: And (the angels say:) ‘Every one of us has an appointed station;
And surely, we ourselves are those who remain standing in rows;
And surely, we ourselves remain engaged in glorifying (Allah).’
And no doubt, these people used to say:

arabic: لَوْ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكْرًا مِّنَ الْأَوَّلِينَ
english: ‘If we (too) had some (Book) of direction and guidance from the bygone people,
Then, certainly, we (too) would have been Allah’s exalted servants.’
But (now) they have rejected this (Qur’an). So they will soon come to know (their end).
And verily, Our command has been put into effect in respect of the servants whom We sent (i.e., the Messengers),
That it is they who have been granted help,
And that essentially it is only Our army that shall dominate.
So turn your attention away from them for a time.
And keep watching them (constantly). So they will soon come to know (their end).
And do they want Our punishment to be hastened?

arabic: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمْ فَسَاءَ صَبَاحُ الْمُنذَرِينَ
english: But when that (torment) descends before them, how evil will be the morning of those who were warned!
So turn your attention away from them for a while.
And keep watching them (constantly). So they will soon come to know (their end).

arabic: سُبْحَانَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ الْعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
english: Holy is your Lord, the Lord of Honour, Transcendent above these (things) which they utter.
And peace be upon (all) the Messengers!
And all praise be to Allah alone, the Lord of all the worlds.
